Ready.name: Ready
Ready.description:
The Ready class provides the functionality of scheduling callbacks
for when a given Ready instance is marked as ready

Asset.name: Asset
Asset.description:
The Asset class represents an script file being loaded within a
module.

Module.name: Module
Module.description: The Module class represents a module within the modl tree. It can load other modules(dependencies contained within node_modules directory) and assets (files referenced within a module).

Loader.name: Loader
Loader.description: The loader class responsible for loading the various dependencies between modules and assets

modl.Util.name: modl.Util
modl.Util.description: Util class that provides inner utils to the outside world

Dispatches the loader processing. It will start loading all
its requires and finally will run the payload function.

classitems.description: Loads a given require
classitems.name: loadRequire

return.description: The promise for when the require is done

classitems.description: Requires an asset from it. The resource string may have the following formats: - "/path/to/asset: in this case the asset within the current module will be loaded - "module": in this case the "module" within node_modules folder will be required, and afterwards the /modl asset within the module will be loaded. - "module/path/to/asset": in this case the "module" within node_modules folder will be required, and afterwards the indicated asset within the module will be loaded. Optionally an alias property may be passed to name the required asset within the imports object. If ommited, the alias will be automatically generated based the resource value.

params.name: resource
params.description: A given resource to be required

params.name: alias
params.description: An optional alias which to be named within the imports object.

classitems.name: require

classitems.description: Schedules a given payload function export the asset. The payload will only run when all the requires are loaded and ready for prime time. When called, the payload function will receive the module struct as its first argument and as second argument, the imports object containing all required resources within will be passed. The module object will have an exports property which will be published for this asset. This property can be overwritten with any value this asset may want to publish (a la nodejs module system). The module object will also have an imports object containing all required resources which will be also passed as a second argument to the payload function
classitems.name: exports

classitems.description: Creates a Loader and requires an asset from it. The resource string may have the following formats: - "/path/to/asset: in this case the asset within the current module will be loaded - "module": in this case the "module" within node_modules folder will be required, and afterwards the /modl asset within the module will be loaded. - "module/path/to/asset": in this case the "module" within node_modules folder will be required, and afterwards the indicated asset within the module will be loaded. Optionally an alias property may be passed to name the required asset within the imports object. If ommited, the alias will be automatically generated based the resource value.

params.name: resource
params.description: A given resource to be required

params.name: alias
params.description: An optional alias which to be named within the imports object.

classitems.name: require

classitems.description: Creates a Loader and schedules a given payload function export the asset. The payload will only run when all the requires are loaded and ready for prime time. When called, the payload function will receive the module struct as its first argument and as second argument, the imports object containing all required resources within will be passed. The module object will have an exports property which will be published for this asset. This property can be overwritten with any value this asset may want to publish (a la nodejs module system). The module object will also have an imports object containing all required resources which will be also passed as a second argument to the payload function
classitems.name: exports

classitems.description: Sets up the modl environment. It will reset all loaded modules and will set up the settings object along with the values passed along with the options parameter. This function MUST be called before any require/exports can be actually made.
classitems.name: setup

The root directory form which to load all
           assets and modules

props.name: debug
props.description:
If this flag is on, it will emit debug
           messages to a console if available

classitems.description: Iterates over an object's properties or an array's values calling the f callback function each time passing the value as it's first argument and the index or property name as it's second argument. The callback function must return either true or false. If for a given property or index the function returns true then the indexOf function will return the current property name or index.
classitems.name: indexOf

params.name: a
params.description: The array or object to be iterated

params.name: f
params.description: The callback function for each iteration

classitems.description: Iterates over an object's properties or an array's values calling the f callback function each time passing the value as it's first argument and the index or property name as it's second argument.
classitems.name: forEach

params.name: a

params.name: f
params.description: The callback function for each iteration

classitems.description: Short for Array.prototype.slice.apply(arguments[0], arguments[1...n])
classitems.name: slice

classitems.description: Iterates over an object's properties or an array's values calling the f callback function each time passing the value as it's first argument and the index or property name as it's second argument. The returned value of each function call is stored in a new array that is returned in the end.
classitems.name: map

params.name: a
params.description: The array or object to be iterated

params.name: f
params.description: The callback function for each iteration

classitems.description: Returns a function that decides which function to call based on the number of arguments passed.
